result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

John D Rice appeared for the State of Wisconsin; Dr duly sworn & testified; Exhibits 1 & 2 marked, offered & received; arguments heard;   The court finds the defn is incompetent, but may likely become comp within the statutory time frame. by Christina M.H. Engen PhD ABPP

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use any public transportation.

NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
DCPS referral

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  John D Rice appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE's motion to amend bond. Argument. State objects to motion to modify. If Court does agree with a signature bond, State is requesting DCPS. Court orders signature bond ($500) w/DCPS (see referral). Court amends condition of:  Defendant shall not remove their pants in public to: Defendant shall not expose penis in public. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
